website_summaries.verdict: It has both positives and negatives: the design is rugged but also less spacious, with fewer bells and whistles than similarly priced models.
pros: Capable of processing 11 cups at a time
Extra-wide feed tube readily handles foods of various sizes
cons: Less spacious than some models that are comparable in price

customer_reviews.title: Good value but silly design error
customer_reviews.text: This is good value for the money, with lots of parts and a heavy duty motor. Stupid design flaw, though - two of the pieces can't be separated, making for a hassle when washing and also making it awkward to use slicing discs with large items like potatoes or large hunks of cheese. It's not a deal breaker, but it was a dumb design choice and a step back from the last Cuisinart I had (which I accidentally destroyed - no fault of Cuisinart's).
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible food processor
customer_reviews.text: This food processor is NOT user friendly at all. The design is horrible, it is so cumbersome that I don't even use it. I thought it was just me, but over the holiday weekend other people tried to use it and had the same issues - ended up just hand grating and chopping. I wish I had returned this when I had the opportunity. I wasted the money on this. Too bad, I thought Cuisinart was a reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chucksmith

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product and bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: A poor quality product from cuisineart. Food processor got broken after sometime even I used it very gently and rarely. I tried to contact with customer care but didn't get any satisfactory answer.
customer_reviews.author: Deep Joshi

customer_reviews.title: Dead Beat
customer_reviews.text: I gathered all my ingredients, read directions and watched YouTube videos on how to use. I was super excited, pushed down the start button and absolutely nothing happened. Tried different outlets and called customer service if it was on Re-call list, but nothing. Such a disappointing experience! Oh, and putting all the pieces back in the box to return, was a nightmare. Saw a few reviews that stated the same issue. Seems like it's Russian roulette if you get a mobile one or a dead beat. What the hell happened to quality check/control Cuisinart???!!
customer_reviews.author: Sera M

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an older model replaced because of a broken bowl
customer_reviews.text: It came with a broken bowl and I had to have it replaced. I wonder if they’ve cheapened the plastic. It was covered by warranty but I had to mail the broken bowl back at my cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The safety switch doesn't engage.
customer_reviews.text: Had the return the first one because of this issue, asked for replacement since most of the reviews were positive and I though I got a defective unit. The replacement worked once after unboxing but stopped working exactly 35 days after purchase. The return window is now closed so need to deal with Cuisinart customer support. This is pretty bad, read the low-star reviews, most of them mention this problem...
customer_reviews.author: Vazgen Karapetyan

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to fit on top
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older Cusinart food processor that I loved. The new design for closing the top is so difficult that I have to wonder if there is something wrong but I read another review with the same complaint. Also the large push tool doesn't detach making it harder to clean. So disappointed . You can not run it if the top isn't set just right. It came with no instructions and said to go on line and watch the instructional video. The online site had no instructional video for the food processor. I sent them an email requesting instructions a month ago and have never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this food processor
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this food processor but I just couldn’t. It’s quiet, has a great capacity, blades were sharp. BUT the first thing I tried to make was a few batches of salsa for canning. Every single batch leaked out of the center. The cone that the blade is attached to is too short and when the salsa liquefied it went under the blade and out the center of the canister...onto the base. There is a warning on the canister to not fill liquid above a certain line, but I didn’t put in liquid, I put in veggies, which is what the processor is intended for. Really bummed. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The small cover did not work on one of the two units I bought
customer_reviews.text: Overall "ok" except that for some reason the cover with the small hole doesn't work on one of the units. No obvious flaw, just is not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: defective units sold.
customer_reviews.text: I realized too late it was a defective product. The lid won't allow you to use large feed tube. You have to take whole lid off to fit food in feed tube then put back on as another purchaser found out . Im not sure who's responsible for giving me a defective unit ,Cuisinart or Amazon for selling it but I just know waited too long to notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. since I didn't know products sold by Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with the top, called Cuisinart (was registered) and told it was not covered by warranty since it was no longer a currently sold product to return it to Amazon, which I couldn't do without the packing. Disappointed. since I didn't know products sold by Amazon weren't covered by warranty
customer_reviews.author: Sew for fun

customer_reviews.title: Amazed by the quality of the Cusinart 11 cup food ...
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for the speed and accuracy in delivering the processor. Amazed by the quality of the Cusinart 11 cup food processor. Quiet and everything is heavy-duty. Thanks. Make sure you get the container to store the super sharp blades. This is a professional unit and superior to what you will buy for less money. My wife was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Colton

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to my original Cuisinart and the price was great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old Cuisinart that needed new parts and was very old. Choice was to spend a fortune on parts, or purchase new. Since it was old, buying new was a better option. Almost identical to my old one. Same size and blades are interchangeable. Cuisinart makes a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: The 11 Cup is Perfect Size!! I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine works great. It's so fast & easy to grate carrots for salad or carrot cake. Potatoes for hashbrowns in the time of a commercial. I just used it to slice apples for a crisp and the larger slicing disk that came with it was perfect. It's solid. It doesn't vibrate on the counter top. It's made very well. Reminds of the really nice one I bought years ago that my daughter "stole" because she loved it so much. Now she doesn't have to feel guilty about borrowing it for so long.
customer_reviews.author: phyllis johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: After 38 yrs, I finally had to replace my original cuisinart - only because I somehow lost the top cover piece. It still works like a champ and had been used nonstop. I got the new one, used it twice... washed it in the dishwasher as noted in the instructions and now the new softer plastic will now not allow the top to fit or click into place. It seems that the quality is now cheaper and the motor feels weaker. Sadly will be sending this back and will buy the next one from a brick and mortar store where I can check it first before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Clunky to assemble each time for different foods
customer_reviews.text: The quality and built are fine and it is sturdy. Not great for chopping small quantities of vegetables. For slicing it is great. I wish there were more accessory blades and tools. The tube at the top is a little bit small in width for slicing cucumbers whole. It's an adequate device but I hoped for better.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Bolender

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my wife’s old cuisinart. Though the motor and base on the old one still works, it was cheaper to buy a new unit than replace the old plastic upper parts which finally broke. On a positive note all the blades from the old unit fit the new unit. On a negative note the alignment of the upper plastic to the base is touchy and it often takes some effort to get it right to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: woodturner

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can use this while my baby is sleeping it's sooo quiet. I would suggest if you're wanting to blend something that's 1-2 cups or less that you size down a bit because it won't even blend things, the blade doesn't go completely to the bottom of the container.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Steele

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: One of the great summer staples that a food processor should make easy work of is cole slaw. This is the only food processor I've seen that makes the shredding task worse. The large feeder tube is so cumbersome and counterintuitive as to make it almost useless. I'm really disgusted because I didn't see the problem until after I threw out the box. Now I have to live with this turd til I can afford one designed by engineers who design with the user in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Manor Padre

customer_reviews.title: Never worked.
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and motor does not work. Trying to figure out how to return without it incurring large shipping charges. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen staple.
customer_reviews.text: This is a kitchen staple and my first stand alone food processor. I’ve had combination units before that do not compare. The only thing I wish is that it would come with the 1mm slicing attachment. For the price it should be included. I’ve only used this a few time. It shredded cabbage for slaw perfectly and evenly ground chicken for chicken salad, and made smooth humus. I love having the second lid without the feed attachment. It is very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: A. ROSSETTI

customer_reviews.title: Love my new food processor
customer_reviews.text: My previous DLC 8 had a cracked bowl and I couldn't find a replacement that would fit the cover I had, so I ordered a new one. Wow! Love the new on/off/pulse controls and the extra cover to use when chopping. The previous reviews talked about being difficult to clean, but I did not experience that at all. The "pusher" releases and can be cleaned separately from the tube. I'm sorry I waited so long to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Marine

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our 35-year-old Cuisinart, and find this one just as good, even better, than the original - if it lasts as long! Our original was made in Japan, but the new one is made in China. But the base and motor seem to be the same, and one of the extra top covers (that the original did not have) that come with this new model is very good and convenient. So our vote is two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kuniholm

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart is not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: The lid for my Kitchenaid food processor (10+ years) could not be replaced. So, I decided to give Cuisinart a try again. I have had Cuisinart food processors over the years and for the most part been pleased. When this model arrived from Amazon, I began unpacking and was amazed at how cheap and flimsy it was. I placed it on the counter with the main blade and locked the unit and lid together. Next, I turned the unit on. It definitely worked, but even empty I knew this processor was a "walker" and would not last. Amazon has been wonderful and I will receive a refund. It's time to go back to Kitchenaid!
customer_reviews.author: serialmom

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart ruined its name with this one
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hate this cheaply made piece of junk. I will NEVER buy cuisinart again. The chopping/mixing blade won't stay in place. It moves up the stem every time so nothing gets chopped or mixed. The on/off buttons are clunky. The safety lock is made of cheap plastic and it doesn't lock half the time - I'm sure it will break very quickly. The pusher sleeve is very awkward to use and hard to clean. I don't know who designed this machine but they should be fired. Severely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Coritz

customer_reviews.title: Model is discontinued. Lousy design.
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart motor is great. The design of the feed tube is ridiculous. Hard to clean hard to operate and looks potentially easily broken. This model is also discontinued so buyer beware. I will consider other models by Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Spikesmama

customer_reviews.title: 4 Cups of Liquid Is Too Much For It
customer_reviews.text: The inner stem is way too short on the "11" cup processor. If you add more than 3 cups of liquid to it, the liquid runs down the inner stem and onto your counter. When I make hummus, I dump in two cans of chick peas and a cup of liquid. With this processor, the liquid runs all over the counter. Useless unless your processing only solids or tiny quantities.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kleinfelter

customer_reviews.title: I love this food processor
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor. This is the 2nd one I have had. My first one was about 12 years old. It is the work horse in my kitchen. The stress I put this machine under is great, from making pizza dough to bread crumbs and it never failed me. The reason for a new one was I put in a very dry chunk of cheese to grate and it cracked the lid, got stuck and rather than unsticking it, I tried to keep grating and seized the motor. Not the product fault but mine.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Grenvich

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the quality, especially compared to the heavy duty food processor I bought over 15 years ago. It feels cheap and flimsy. And it takes a few tries to match the pieces when putting the lid on. I wish I'd spent a little more and bought a commercial model.
customer_reviews.author: Sam in Montana

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Where to begin? Really hard to assemble. Really hard to clean. Poor performance with cheese, mushrooms, celery, blending. I love Cuisinart and this product got a very high review from a usually dependable source. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Rotten design
customer_reviews.text: I genuinely hate this thing. This is my 3rd Cuisinart food processor. I totally loved the last 2 I had, and only upgraded because they eventually get a little dull and the plastic gets cloudy after a lot of use. I’ve never had one die. Anyway this one has been a total lemon. I hate the “safety” features. I hate the way the lid locks on, I hate cleaning it, I hate everything about it. It’s a poor design, apparently more focused on safety than being user friendly. Those 2 things should not be at odds, but in this instance, they are.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: it is good, but please note the top locks unusually
customer_reviews.text: it is good, but please note the top locks unusually: it locks in the back. It took awhile to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: RKDR

customer_reviews.title: S blade flying out
customer_reviews.text: Grind meat beginning went fine until meat stacked in between blade, blade fly out, fortunately inside the bowl when it happened
customer_reviews.author: bichquyen vuong

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: This is such a brilliant product, like somebody said dunno how I was managing without this all my life. It does what it says it does. Cooking has become super quick with this. I made shami Kebabs with it the day I received it. Used it for couple of things since I got it. Planning to knead pizza dough with it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Positively not made to be easy.
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say but this is a on and off machine, that's it. No in between, mix, slow mix. So on. When using the bread mixer you have to hold on for dear life, the bowl goes all over the place. Safety wise, you have to have the top on before the machine will turn on, which if it's not perfectly straight and I mean straight this thing won't turn on. Then if you happen to have a ruler on hand then you can line it up. Way to long for this process.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality on the market.
customer_reviews.text: They added a safety feature that I hate!! The large plunger has a safety switch, so, you cannot load the feed/hopper and the safety switch has to be engaged before it will run. It runs quietly, and had a powerful motor, I loved my older version but it finally gave up the ghost after 25 years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Carrison

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the two of us. Capable of prepping for 5-6 though. Easy cleanup. Quiet operation. Didn’t want one that would be a counter top behemoth. This one is the Goldilocks cuisinart. Also, love the two lids that come with it as opposed to just one the other models get.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: After going through 3 different processors, all bought at low prices, whatever was on sale. And all 3 crapping out in less than a year I decided to spend a little more. First off, this thing is super quiet, you can actually use it without OSHA hearing protection required... lol Secondly it is powerful, it can power through anything you stick in it. I am sold, worth every penny, and I would recommend to anyone looking for an upgrade to the common junk that goes for less than $60...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Almost as easy as my 30 year old original version.
customer_reviews.text: Ease of operation. I've had my old Cuisinart for over 30 years and I kept nursing it along because I hated some of the safety features of 10 year ago that made the machine downright difficult to operate. Finally couldn't nurse my old one along anymore so had to buy another. This is much easier than the one I bought my Mom 10 years ago that she never used because it was too complicated. Glad this is better.
customer_reviews.author: LVRR

customer_reviews.title: Don't Recommend:  Huge design flaw makes it only for dry goods
customer_reviews.text: This is a ridiculous design flaw. The center post is so short that it allows liquids to flow up and out ,all over the machine and counters. If all you want to do is slice and shred solids like vegetables and cheese you will be OK. If you want to incorporate liquids you are going to make a mess. Sent Back. Bought another manufacturer's machine. Thankfully AMAZON is great with returns!
customer_reviews.author: MTDreams

customer_reviews.title: complicated
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality machine and does what it says it will do - but I hate how complicated it is to use. The large feed tube is a joke. The way it is configured, you still have to cut everything up to fit it in there. It's really stupid. It's like they went overboard on installing unnecessary safety features that truly just get in the way and make using the machine a hassle. So - although it really is a good machine - I wish I had gotten something else.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: works well! a bit tricky to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is so efficient I love it! It is just a bit of a hassle to get it together because it's not clear how to put it together to get it working. I usually end up putting it together 2-3 times before it starts to work for the safety mechanisms. I do like it when I can get it to work! Not the most intuitive but really great when you get the hang of it!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi A Schnee

customer_reviews.title: Little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this 11 cup cuisinart, and am very happy with it! This machine is substantial and weighty. The bowl is a heavier plastic than my old one, and it's simple to use. This machine's motor runs at a low hum, and doesn't shriek while working.I also purchased the caddy that stores the cuisinart blades! Keeps fingers safe! Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lori N.

customer_reviews.title: I was glad I could replace it and know how to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing one I bought many years ago. I was glad I could replace it and know how to use it right away. It is wonderful. I just bought a new blade holder box for it. I will still use my old one after I order some missing parts, like the blade holder stem. After moving twice I had finally lost 2 slicing blades and the stem, thus the need for a new machine. The motor still works great on the old one and will be fine for the summer home.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Blomquist

customer_reviews.title: Time-consuming
customer_reviews.text: I give up. For the amount of time I spend trying to get the bowl to lock onto the unit and/or the cover to lock onto the bowl and/or the pusher to lock onto the cover I could be grating everything by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a super quiet and powerful processor! It exceeded my expectations. I probably should have bought a larger one but 11 cups works for me better than expected. Everything you need is included, but storage container is a good addition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY DUTY MOTOR - WEIGHT OF MACHINE - QUICK QUICK QUICK
customer_reviews.text: This is a food processor.....period. This is a piece of kitchen equipment that every home MUST have. Has increased efficiency by a factor of 10 times (10 times faster than anything the human hand can do). Safe. Quick to clean. Did not know what we were missing (unfortunately). Recommend as a go to slicer, shredder and chopper...PERIOD!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This FP Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one reason at the time - I wanted to make Toum (garlic paste) for my family. This sucker is powerful and since making the Toum I have found even more uses for it. We just did prime rib with a garlic-basil crust that I prepared in this FP and it took a matter of seconds to turn those fresh herbs and spices into an amazing spread. I am so glad I bought this - it was worth every single penny!
customer_reviews.author: LittleAche

customer_reviews.title: Disaapointing
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Used it once, struggled with closing, not intuitive at all, not impressed with chopping capabilities. Back it went. I expect more from a device in 2020. Went with the Breville instead. Took the plunge. What. A. Delight. Save up and go with this instead. You owe it to yourself. Alternatively, do manual meal prep. It’s therapeutic and will save you money. But do not waste your hard earned money on compromises.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: Loved the compact cover. My old Cuisinart only had the big cover, and it wasn’t as convenient to use, clean, and store. And my old one was 14 cups, which is too big for normal use; this one at 11 cups is much more practical
customer_reviews.author: Barbara H.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! I bought my wife the same one 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! I bought my wife the same one 20 years ago. When i purchased this one, I figured they would had put cheaper parts in it, etc... as is the norm these days. But surprise!!! This product actually got BETTER in time. Your wife will love you for this one guys!
customer_reviews.author: 5dwarves

customer_reviews.title: this is a cheap knock-off
customer_reviews.text: blade flew off inside bowl while in use! I've had Cuisinarts on my counter for 25+ years. but not like this. one...very cheap feeling...plastic bowl to blade...I can't recommend!
customer_reviews.author: darkestyet

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Professional Like Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: The food processor is powerful, well made and has high quality materials. It does everything well. Perfect for the home. Almost like having a professional model. I like that it can slice my vegetables thick or thin because it came with two sized slicer blades. The only negative is that the pusher assembly can't be taken apart for easy cleaning. But the dish washer doesn't have an issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good food processor
customer_reviews.text: My food processor is in use nearly every day. My first 11 cup Cuisinart food processor I bought in 1985. Still runs like a charm but can't get the bowls replaced anymore. Bought the new Cuisinart 11 cup. Seems okay but isn't as heavy or seem as sturdy. We will see how long this one lasts. This bowl does fit my old base so am not discarding it. It will be my backup.
customer_reviews.author: KCJoan

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart I had used (maybe over-used?) for 35 years finally broke off a small plastic piece and rather than trying to replace that part I decided to get a new one. I'm very happy with this new one, which is very similar but upgraded a bit. If it lasts another 35 years, my descendants will be using it. I wish MY body parts lasted as long!
customer_reviews.author: wisgardener

customer_reviews.title: Never had one before. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Made my very first bread dough in it. It mixed AND kneaded it!!! Only took about 10 to 12 pulses. But hold onto the machine, the dough will make it rock around. Looking forward to making other things with it.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Parts not included!
customer_reviews.text: We received the Cusinart 11 cup processor today and after checking it out we did not get the DVD or the dough blade as described in the video on the Amazon site. Might need to return for misrepresentation of product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobart

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This, except...
customer_reviews.text: I have two complaints: (1) is getting the lid on correctly. Its a bit of a squeeze to get it on "just so" or it won't work. (2) attaching the post to the slicer blades. I struggled with that for a good ten minutes, went through the book couple times (no help), before I had the "aha" moment to slide the little button down. Otherwise, its pretty dang awesome
customer_reviews.author: Megan Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Cuisinart processor in the past that was very similar to this new 11 cup processor. I used my old one for many years until I finally wore it out. I use it mostly for shedding vegetables for soups and salads. I also use it on a daily basis for pureeing food for my 95 year old mother-in-law who is unable to chew her food - a life saver in this area. Other uses are for making almond butter and even on occasion grinding coffee beans in small amounts. Great machine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this food processor
customer_reviews.text: I like this food processor. I researched it and I like the smaller size than the 14 cup. I cook mostly for my self and this is easier to use and move in and out of the cupboard. It shreds cheese and vegetables well and with ease. I have used the bowl processor for hummus, pie crust, salsa and I like how it performs.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Clay

customer_reviews.title: New and improved
customer_reviews.text: I have used my first Cusinart food processor for a good 30 plus years. It worked as great as the first day I used it, but the bowl had cracks and breaks but the motor still ran. I knew it was only a matter of time before it would fail due to those cracks so I decided to replace it! WOW have they made some changes and improvements. It took a while to get used to the new configuration but I love it as much as ever.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B James

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this almost more than me.
customer_reviews.text: My husband giggled like a child when I gave this to him. The large easy to use buttons are nice. It’s also not nearly as loud as the last one we had. The sheer fact he’s used it so many times makes it worth the hefty price.
customer_reviews.author: E. P.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for same model
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same model I've had for too many years. It wasnt much more to purchase a new one instead of replacing the pieces I needed. I'll keep the old one as a backup
customer_reviews.author: David Grygier

customer_reviews.title: You don't realize how useful Cuisinart FPs are till you have one
customer_reviews.text: Heavy. Make sure your counter can support its weight. Sturdy and definitely easier than cutting things by hand. Useful for other kinds of food processing besides (like mixing dough) with the right attachment blade.
customer_reviews.author: TamTomTimTikki

customer_reviews.title: Great to have.
customer_reviews.text: This machine replaces one I used for over 20 years. It works great. I make pie dough, chop and slice vegetables, mix hummus, it can do about anything. It lives up to Cuisinart's good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: QueenD

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and energy
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I don't know how I lived without this thing. After visiting my in-laws so many times and seeing their older model Cuisinart I finally decided to get one. Oh boy is this thing great, Lots of power, easy to clean and even easier to use. I love that it comes with three separate blade things as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.B.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Read lots of reviews and they were all over the place for this.. so far so good but I do get what others were saying about the lid being a little odd..
customer_reviews.author: Phillygirl

customer_reviews.title: A Good Kitchen Choice
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of user options and attachments (+) so it takes some time to learn how to get the most out of it (-). But all in all very happy with it. Sturdy construction and good documentation included.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The food processor works great. I also ordered a dough attachment for it from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SiriusReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as a Christmas gift and am glad i did. Fantastic pro model with lots of power. We made homemade Salsa and it came out perfect . Cuisinart is a name to trust . I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw frustration
customer_reviews.text: After using this device for six months I've finally had enough. I wish I never purchased it to begin with. The cover doesn't fit right. Try shredding large veggies, it doesn't work. What a waste of money. Do yourself a favor, don't buy this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J. Hascall

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a food processor that made a bit too much noise. Our kitchen is connected to the family room and when we're watching TV I don't get complaints about any noise. Only down side is I find the tops of the bowl a bit hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry French

customer_reviews.title: Bowl not well made.  Flimsy locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this a low review. The locking mechanism on the bowl broke in less than 60 days. One of the tabs that holds the lid locked to the bowl broke off. The product is not usable at this point. Hopefully Cuisinart will stand behind their unit. I will update my review at that time. Edit. Amazon has come through. We were just outside the 30 day window when the tab broke off. They stood behind it, and are a,lowing for a return. Still haven't heard anything back from Cuisinart. They have to know about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job. Creates short work of the more time consuming prep tasks. Cleans fairly easily. But for the price I wish it came with the 6mm slicing blade. If anything the 4mm blade should be the optional one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great processor!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an earlier model of this processor years ago and then made the mistake of buying a Kitchen Aid which was bulky and fell apart after just two years of work. Cuisinart is by far the best. Easy to clean, use, does a great job, and works for years!
customer_reviews.author: lizzy m

customer_reviews.title: Almost like the original
customer_reviews.text: This model was nearly the same as our original one that we had for decades! The only part we missed was the blade for bread.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A. Steklenski

customer_reviews.title: This food processor is the first one that I've owned but I love it. I don't get super complicated
customer_reviews.text: Yes yes yes. This food processor is the first one that I've owned but I love it. I don't get super complicated... Hummus and grating cheese so far. Lots of hummus. But it does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Second lid
customer_reviews.text: I decided I needed a better food processor than the one I was using. After trying out, my neighbor’s 14-cup Cuisinart, I decided to buy the 11-cup because I wanted a smaller food processor and most importantly, this food processor has a flat, easy to clean second lid. So far, I am mostly making very smooth nut butters and hummus and some sauces. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: AlbanyKnicks

customer_reviews.title: perfect food processor
customer_reviews.text: perfect. functional, simple, easy to clean, no unnecessary bells and whistles. sturdy, heavy, stays on counter well.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon

customer_reviews.title: safety clips are useless, plastic is low grade and has cracked twice ...
customer_reviews.text: safety clips are useless, plastic is low grade and has cracked twice already. That would have never have happened with a previous unit. The motor has no power. This has to be a lower grade for Amazon or something. Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy123

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as shown on video
customer_reviews.text: The product preforms very well but does not come with the dough blade as shown in all the videos. When we called the support line it took 15 minutes to speak to someone. Not much help from this department. Ended up ordering the dough blade from the support line only to find cheaper dough blades on Amazon. What gives!
customer_reviews.author: TERRIM

customer_reviews.title: 11 Cups?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a DLC-5 (type 25) 7 cup processor. I quickly discovered that the bowl sizes were nearly identical. There was a 3/4" height difference in the bowls but I don't see how you can fit 4 cups in that space. A bit disappointed in the descriptions accuracy as I was expecting a sizeable difference. I have used it and it performs well, but has a delicate interlock on the chute that I fear may break easily. The motor is heavy like my old one so the stability is good. I'll likely keep it now that I have it but I might not have pulled the trigger had I known what I know now.
customer_reviews.author: mikey

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for one purpose. I needed to blend puppy mush for pups 3-8 weeks old. It is OK, but it has some design flaws which make keeping it clean difficult. Also, it has limited capacity, despite the large bowl you see.
customer_reviews.author: L Bradford

customer_reviews.title: A great buy, hope this one holds up as well
customer_reviews.text: I use my Cuisinart all the time. I had one over 20 years and the plastic started to break apart... A great buy, hope this one holds up as well!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leahcat

customer_reviews.title: missing parts
customer_reviews.text: in the video, she talks about and shows you the dough blade. . . .this arrived without a dough blade. I WANT MY DOUGH BLADE - FOR $175, THIS SHOULD NOT BE MISSING A PART
customer_reviews.author: mizL69

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Use
customer_reviews.text: Has made food prep much easier for us. No worries about old hands trying to chop stuff anymore. Works better than advertised for us. Recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Product Line
customer_reviews.text: This unit is slightly smaller that the previous one, also a cuisinart, and even though we have not used the new one yet I can say the previous on was in use for more than twenty years and that, in my book, speaks well for the brand.
customer_reviews.author: John Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the food processor as a gift for our daughter. Her old food processor was the same brand and it lasted for 15 years. Cuisinart is always a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Unger

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for my DLC 7 Pro
customer_reviews.text: After 35 years, my DLC 7 Pro needed to be replaced. It had done everything I had asked of it. First, I tried the new Cuisinart Elemental design food processor. It was awkward to use and quit after using it twice. In all a terrible design. I purchased the Cuisinart DLC-8SY Pro Custom 11-Cup Food Processor and I LOVE IT! It's the larger version of my old DLC 7 PRO which was a champ. We'll see if this one lasts 35 years.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley Moller

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DLC-8SY Pro Custom 11-Cup Food Processor, White
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor. I had the same exact model for 21 years until the plastic that you place the blade over broke. I ordered this which exactly the same and it's as perfect as the original. I just used it last week and it performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Maniloff

customer_reviews.title: Allot of features in one appliance.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it has all he features I was looking for in one appliance. Since I purchased it my family is creating meals using fresh vegetables and fruits. We have been experimenting with new recipes and it’s been fun.
customer_reviews.author: SRod

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Used once since receipt to make latkes for Hanukkah. Worked great. One question, I am having trouble figuring out how to remove the large feed tube for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: herbbob

customer_reviews.title: Initial quality as expected, lid/top manipulation tight
customer_reviews.text: As expected, the quality of the machine and ease of use is top notch. We had a previous, more basic model that lasted us close to 20 years and the bowl finally cracked. We upgraded with this one and are not disappointed. However, the closing for both tops is extremely tight and my wife has had problems a few times getting it to move. But that is a minor "issue" and is more than offset by all of the other positives.
customer_reviews.author: David Crownover

customer_reviews.title: A perfect size for a Food Processor!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking to go a little smaller and more lightweight than the BIG Cuisinart we had. This is the perfect size and is easy to move from place to place. It still has every feature we need in a food processor. Amazon had a GREAT deal on it, and anything I can buy with Amazon Prime makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: D. DiNardo

customer_reviews.title: I love it and highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This processor is heavy and well constructed. I love it and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Glass

customer_reviews.title: Simple but great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this food processor because it was exactly like my previous one that lasted for 10+ years. It's easy use, not fancy electronics just a pulse button and a full run button. This did come with a few extra accessories my old one didn't but probably won't even use them. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: dogmom

customer_reviews.title: The best food processor made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a good friend. I have one and use it often. They love it and also use it often. I also cheat and use mine to start my pasta dough. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Andronaco

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor
customer_reviews.text: I use this processor as a blender too and it has exceeded my expectations for all jobs I have put it through thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Therese Meckaensziey

customer_reviews.title: Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy product. I like it. Going to take some practice to be comfortable using. You Tube has good videos on assembly and use. Use great caution handling blades.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I appreciate that it doesn't start until each piece is clicked in perfectly. Hard to clean the crevices. I really with it came with an accessory holder.
customer_reviews.author: K🖖🏻

product_meta.title: Cuisinart DLC-8SBCY Pro Custom 11-Cup Food Processor, Brushed Chrome
product_meta.description: Color:Brushed ChromeGreat for the chef, features 11-cup work bowl and extra-large feed tube for slicing whole fruits and vegetables. Powerful enough to knead bread with ease. With stainless steel medium, thin and shredding/slicing discs, and chopping blade. 5-year full motor warranty. In white, almond or black. Model DLC-8SBCY.
feature_bullets: Includes new chopping blade, three slicing/shredding discs, spatula
Ideal for making dough, slicing vegetables, shredding cheese, mincing garlic and herbs, mixing batters, emulsifying
11-cup work bowl large enough for a family.UC Cubic Feet: 1.07
Extra-large feed tube for larger food slices. Stainless steel thin slicing disc (2mm) and medium slicing disc (4mm)
Five-year full motor warranty, three-year limited entire unit warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,331 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
